title: Musk Completes Twitter Acquisition with $44 Billion in Saudi and Oligarch Funding
description: Elon Musk completed his $44 billion acquisition of Twitter, with significant funding from Saudi Prince Alwaleed bin Talal ($1.89 billion), Qatar Investment Authority ($375 million), and Oracle founder Larry Ellison ($1 billion). The acquisition immediately raised national security concerns as Saudi Arabia became Twitter's second-largest investor despite its record of imprisoning critics for social media posts.

sources.title: Musk's Twitter investors include Saudi prince, Dorsey and Qatar
Saudis 'second largest investors' in Twitter after Musk takeover
Saudi's Prince Alwaleed, Qatar wealth fund: Meet the investors who funded Elon Musk's Twitter buyout

title: Senator Murphy Calls for National Security Investigation of Saudi Control of Twitter
description: Senator Chris Murphy requested a Committee on Foreign Investment investigation into Saudi Arabia's stake in Twitter, warning that 'the Saudis, who have a clear interest in repressing political speech and impacting U.S. politics, are now the second-largest owner of a major social media platform.' The request highlighted that Saudi Arabia had sentenced U.S. citizen Saad Ibrahim Almadi to 16 years in prison for critical tweets.

sources.title: Sen. Chris Murphy calls for investigation into Saudi Arabia's stake in Twitter after Elon Musk's takeover
Democratic senator calls for probe of Saudi Arabia's stake in Twitter after Musk takeover
Senate Democrat wants national security investigation of Saudi Arabia's role in Elon Musk-Twitter deal

title: X Algorithm Manipulated to Boost Conservative Content After Musk's Trump Endorsement
description: Following Trump's assassination attempt and Musk's subsequent endorsement on July 13, 2024, research by Timothy Graham and Mark Andrejevic revealed systematic algorithmic changes on X that boosted Musk's post views by 138.27% (approximately 6.4 million additional views from a baseline of 4.43 million). The study found evidence of potential algorithmic bias favoring Republican content, with Republican accounts gaining an additional 952,300 views post-endorsement.

sources.title: New research points to possible algorithmic bias on X
